page.title: 13RELIGION:LOCAL CHURCHES
page.content: {St Mary the Virgin} at North Stoke is one of the many{local churches}which in the middle ages belonged to the Abbey of Bec in Normandy. The font dates from the 13th century ,as does the original building.The upper the tower was rebuilt 1n 1726 with Georgian brick.this date can be seen on the tower. The most interesting feature of the church is the 14th century wall paintings.Although faded and damaged, some scenes can still be made out. A guide to them can be found at the back of the church inthe form of a plaque. This Church,which still holds regular sevices,is mentioned in the original Domesday Book.
